definition: to pile up/to stack/a pile/a stack
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated

sentences.english: It's just easier to carry an iPad than to have to carry a bunch of books in your backpack.
sentences.chinese: 背包里携带一个iPad比背一大摞书方便多了。

sentences.english: Do not pile clothes on your ironing board.
sentences.chinese: 再也别把一大堆衣服摞在熨衣板上啦。

sentences.english: I have two black toenails, blisters on top of blisters on my toes.
sentences.chinese: 我的脚趾出现了两个黑趾甲，水泡摞着水泡。

sentences.english: How can I be through with such a whole bunch of books in ten days?
sentences.chinese: 十天内怎么才能看完这么一大摞书啊？

sentences.english: What would you get if you stacked thousands of pizza pies on top of each other?
sentences.chinese: 如果你把几千个匹萨饼重叠着摞起来会得到什么？

sentences.english: I went to thebookstore and bought a shelfful of volumes, then stayed up half the nightdevouring them.
sentences.chinese: 我去书店买了一大摞书，熬到半夜研究它们。

sentences.english: The Norwegian also teeters on a pile of chairs placed on a boulder over a 1,000m gap.
sentences.chinese: 他用一组椅子摞在卵石上，然后在椅子上摆造型。

sentences.english: In the end, the turtle at the bottom of the pile is the American taxpayer.
sentences.chinese: 最终，被一大摞海龟压在最底层的是美国的纳税人。

sentences.english: He drew a bulky manuscript from his outside coat pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他从外衣口袋掏出了一大摞稿子。

sentences.english: Besides, five composition notebook pile up tidily down there.
sentences.chinese: 此外，就是摞得整整齐齐的五摞作文本。

sentences.english: Today, I was going over some paperwork with my back to my office door.
sentences.chinese: 今天我抱着一大摞文件用后背顶开办公室门。

sentences.english: He put both hands on the duffel bag, feeling the stacks of bills inside.
sentences.chinese: 他把两手放在破布袋子上，感受着里面一摞摞的钞票。

sentences.english: I notice a great stack ofpapersjust inside the door.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到店门里边放着一大摞报纸。

definition: to fold/to fold over in layers/to furl/to layer/to pile up/to repeat/to duplicate
classifier for sheets of papers etc: pile, pad/Taiwan pr. [ta4]
to pile up/to heap up/a mass/pile/heap/stack/large amount
to pile up like a mountain (idiom)/a mountain of (paperwork etc)/a large number of sth
drawer/stackable cooking vessel/woven mat on a bed frame or chair/woven window screen
